measured_by: difference between observed and optimal timing responses (t_obs − t_opt)
justification: “we focused on the relationship between the mean observed timing response t_obs and the optimal timing response t_opt ( = t_obs − t_opt ) … the timing strategy was considered as risk-seeking … risk-aversive … or risk-neutral (timing difference equals to 0).”
“To analyze the individual optimality, we adopted the Relative Optimality (RO)… that is, the observed mean point p_obs divided by the corresponding optimal point p_opt : RO = p_obs ⁄ p_opt.”
